definition: branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The fruit or seed of a leguminous plant such as or or lentils .
sentences.chinese: 豆科植物的果實或種子，如豌豆，菜豆，等。

sentences.english: The lean man leans on the wash bean plant to read a foliage pamphlet.
sentences.chinese: 瘦人斜靠在乾淨的豆科植物上讀葉片傳單。

sentences.english: These are derived from wild yams and soybeans.
sentences.chinese: 天然黃體酮萃取自野生山藥和豆科植物。

sentences.english: The leguminous lectin played an important role in the recognition of Rhizobia .
sentences.chinese: 豆科植物凝集素在對根瘤菌的識別中起重要作用。

sentences.english: Any leguminous plant having leaves divided into three leaflets .
sentences.chinese: 任意一種葉子長成三個豆科植物。

sentences.english: The lean man leans on the neat bean plant to peruse a foliage pamphlet.
sentences.chinese: 瘦人斜靠在乾淨的豆科植物上讀葉片傳單。

sentences.english: Cassia seed, the leguminous plant, is the food material which can be used as medicine and food.
sentences.chinese: 豆科植物決明子，是藥食兩用的食品原料。

sentences.english: The lean man leans on the clean leafy bean plant .
sentences.chinese: 那個瘦人斜靠在乾淨多葉的豆科植物上。

sentences.english: Water was the limited factor for legumes distributing and the nodule formation.
sentences.chinese: 水分是新疆豆科植物的分佈與共生結瘤的限制性因素。

sentences.english: Seed or pod of certain leguminous plants.
sentences.chinese: 某些豆科植物的種子或莢果。

definition: Graminae or Poaceae, the grass family
Asteraceae or Compositae (composites), a large family of dicotyledonous plants producing scents, includes aster, daisy and sunflower
dicotyledon (plant family distinguished by two embryonic leaves, includes daisies, broadleaved trees, herbaceous plants)
Amaranthaceae, family of herbaceous plants containing Chinese spinach (Amaranthus inamoenus) 莧菜
Labiatae, the taxonomic family including lavender, mint
monocotyledon (plant family distinguished by single embryonic leaf, includes grasses, orchids and lilies)
